Question 74) In the heredogram, the filled symbols represent people with a rare type of genetic disease. Men are represented by squares and women, by circles.
What is the inheritance pattern observed for this disease?
A) autosomal dominant, because the disease appears in both sexes.
B) recessive sex -related, as the father's transmission to the children does not occur.
C) recessive Y -linked to Y, as the disease is transmitted from heterozygous parents to their children.
D) dominant gender linked, as all daughters of affected men also have the disease.
E) autosomal codominant, as the disease is inherited by the children of both sexes, both father and mother.
